text:
Arashiyama Bamboo Grove, Kyoto

Arashiyama Bamboo Forest in Kyoto, Japan


The Sagano Bamboo Forest is

, a district on the western outskirts of Kyoto. Paths wind through towering bamboo groves, with the sun peaking between the green stalks and creating an enchanting effect. The bamboo forest is equally famous for its beauty as for the characteristic sounds created by the bamboo stalks swaying in the wind.

messages.text:
Mount Koya

Mount Koya is the spiritual home of Shingon Buddhism, a sect founded more than 1,200 years ago by one of Japanâ€™s most important religious figures, Kobo Daishi. The sectâ€™s head temple, Kongobu-ji, is set on the forest-covered mountaintop of Mount Koya. Over 100 other temples have been established around Mount Koya, many of which offer visitors an overnight stay.

messages.text:
Shikoku Island

Shikoku is Japanâ€™s fourth largest island, located southwest of the main island of Honshu to which it is connected via two bridge systems. This island is also tied to influential monk Kobo Daishi as the home of the 88 Temple route, one of the countryâ€™s most important pilgrimages. Aside from attracting those seeking spiritual fulfilment, the island offers some spectacular coastlines, mountain ranges, and tumbling rivers.

messages.text:
Kiso Valley

The Kiso Valley is home to the Nakasendo trail, one of only five Edo-period highways connecting Edo (Tokyo) and Kyoto. Travelers during this time made this long journey on foot and, as a result, the Kiso Valley is dotted with historic post towns where travelers once rested, ate, and slept along the way. Itâ€™s possible to walk a section of this old highway, between mountains and through thick forests, as well as visit some of the well-preserved towns.

messages.text:
Matsumoto Castle

Matsumoto Castle is one of only a handful of original castles remaining in Japan. Initially built in 1504, it was expanded to its current form in the late 16th and early 17th centuries. Nicknamed Karasu-jÅ (Crow Castle), itâ€™s known for its beautiful black-and-white three-turreted main keep.

messages.text:
Last night a "ball of light" flew in the sky over Japan. A large incandescent ball flew across the sky, which experts mistook for a fireball or a particularly bright shooting star. Many eyewitnesses began to share what they saw on social networks. He was seen in several prefectures in the south of the country at once. By the way, this is not the first time that the fall of a bright space object is recorded in Japan. The last time the Japanese observed the car at the end of November 2020.

messages.text: New Louis Vuitton flagship store in Tokyo's Ginza district. In total, the building has 7 floors, and was designed by two virtuoso architects - Jun Aoki and Peter Marino. Jun Aoki made the outer faÃ§ade look like water: the outer windows pulsate and bend, creating a three-dimensional effect that produces endless color variations. The interior design of the building was designed by Peter Marino. It emphasizes the organic aesthetics of the building with a central staircase in sculpted oak framed by glass. An equally striking part of the store is the upper level, where Le CafÃ© V is located, which houses the famous chef Yosuke Suga.

text_entities.text: New Louis Vuitton flagship store in Tokyo's Ginza district. In total, the building has 7 floors, and was designed by two virtuoso architects - Jun Aoki and Peter Marino. Jun Aoki made the outer faÃ§ade look like water: the outer windows pulsate and bend, creating a three-dimensional effect that produces endless color variations. The interior design of the building was designed by Peter Marino. It emphasizes the organic aesthetics of the building with a central staircase in sculpted oak framed by glass. An equally striking part of the store is the upper level, where Le CafÃ© V is located, which houses the famous chef Yosuke Suga.

text:
Name : Your Lie In April

Author : ARAKAWA Naoshi

Genre: Drama, Romance, Shounen, Slice of Life

Type: Manga

Released: 2011

Status: Complete

Description:
Piano prodigy Arima Kosei dominated the competition and all child musicians knew his name. But after his mother, who was also his instructor, passed away, he had a mental breakdown while performing at a recital that resulted in him no longer being able to hear the sound of his piano even though his hearing was perfectly fine. Even two years later, Kosei hasn't touched the piano and views the world in monotone, and without any flair or color. He was content at living out his life with his good friends Tsubaki and Watari until, one day, a girl changed everything. Miyazono Kaori is a pretty, free spirited violinist whose playing style reflects her personality. Kaori helps Kosei return to the music world and show that it should be free and mold breaking unlike the structured and rigid style Kosei was used to.

Channel :

Since March 1, 2011, Ted Ed has provided a wide range of classes, from visual arts to mathematics,
 health studies, and business. Each video features entertaining animations, with lessons taught in a fun way 
using interesting examples.
As of 2019, Ted Ed has 10.2 million subscribers and the channel has been viewed around 1.6 billion times

2. Crash Course

This channel launched on May 19, 2006, with the purpose of teaching a wide range of subjects such as world history, biology, 
and even psychology.With 10.2 million subscribers and over 1.5 billion views, Crash Course uses a combination of 
historical footage, descriptive illustrations, and humor to keep viewers informed and entertained.

3. C.G.P. Grey

Started on Aug 12, 2010, this channel focuses on providing classes in history, politics, philosophy, 
and technology.C.G.P. Grey currently has more than 4.2 million subscribers and has been viewed over 
483 million times.

4. Vsauce

This channel started uploading science lessons during the summer of 2010. Each lesson is focused on 
answering an intriguing rhetorical question such as â€œWhat if the Sun disappeared?â€
To date, Vsauce has 15 million subscribers and more than 1.7 billion views and counting.

5. Khan Academy

Since November 16, 2006, this channel has provided tutoring in subjects such as math, science, computing, 
and economics.In each lesson, the teacher explains the concept and provides examples in front of you â€” just 
like in real life!This channel has 5.24 million subscribers and 1,708,601,969 views.

6. Veritasium

Since July 21, 2010, Veritasium has provided an insiders look at science, innovations, and places of interest. 
Each video includes demonstrations, interviews and/or tours in order to give you a 3-dimensional look at the 
subject matter.

7. AsapSCIENCE

Launched on May 28, 2012, AsapSCIENCE teaches scientific concepts in a simple, laid-back way.
Each lesson includes illustrations to help you take in knowledge, while the narrators explain theories in an
 easy-to-understand manner.

8. Common Sense Education

This channel has provided students and teachers with tips on how to use technology in education since February 8, 
2011.Common Sense Education has over 26,000 subscribers and over 7 million views

9. Edutopia

Launched on May 1, 2007, Edutopia informs teachers and students about the latest education techniques that are
 working for learners in K-12 education.This channel will be especially helpful to you if you are an aspiring 
teacher studying Education who wants to provide students with some unique value.At present, this channel has 
114,000 subscribers and more than 23 million views.

10. Big Think

Since October 1, 2006, this channel has provided stimulating content from an array of experts, including famous
 names such as Bill Nye and Neil deGrasse Tyson.To date, this channel has 2.68 million subscribers and 
326,416,123 views.
